<Heading
  as={"h1"}

>
</Heading>

<MethodEndpoint
  method={"get"}
  path={"/api/v1.0/sites/status/types"}
  context={"endpoint"}
>
  
</MethodEndpoint>



Retrieves all site status type definitions that represent lifecycle stages for tenant sites. Status types categorize sites by their operational state (e.g., Testing, Production, Onboarding, Suspended).

**Use Cases**
- Build site administration interfaces showing current site status
- Populate status dropdowns for site management operations
- Audit site lifecycle stages across your organization
- Validate status type references before updating site configuration

**Response Fields**
- `SiteStatusTypeId` - UUID used when referencing status types in site updates
- `Name` - Display name (e.g., "Testing", "Production", "Onboarding")
- `DisplayOrder` - Sort position for consistent UI rendering
- `IsActive` - Whether sites can currently be assigned this status
- `IsOnboarding` - True if this status indicates a site is still being set up

**Workflow Example**
1. List status types: [GET /api/v1.0/sites/status/types](/docs/api/sites/list-site-status-types) → extract available status options
2. Get details for specific type: [GET /api/v1.0/sites/status/types/\{SiteStatusTypeId\}](/docs/api/sites/get-site-status-type-by-id)
3. View site's current status via [GET /api/v1.0/sites/\{siteUrl\}](/docs/api/sites/get-site-by-url) → check `Status` object

**Notes**: Status types are system-defined and cannot be created or modified via API. The available types are consistent across all IncidentIQ tenants.

  body={undefined}
